result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Hazard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.  Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes. Obtain and maintain employment. Minimun of 25 hours per week. Job training, school, work or community service.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  No contact with victim, Diane P.  without prior court approval. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT. (Costs also apply to case 2013CF5610).  Restitution is set at zero.
DEFENDANT MAY NOT HAVE ANY PETS.
No firearms; weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review which agent is to request.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian K Hazard
Current: 401 E Center Street  Apt 112, Adams, WI 53910 United States  (Effective: 10-02-2017)

ADDRESS INFO for Brian K Hazard

Prior: 954 West Ohio Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215
No reply from surety or defendant.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($1,000.00) ad

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Diane P and Michael Olszak. 
 Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to all other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 72 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Diane P. 
   without prior court approval.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
   Minimun of 25 hours per week.
   Job training, school, work or community service. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.   
   --- Costs also apply to case 2013CF5610).
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant may not have any pets.
**AGENT TO REQUEST DATE FOR PROBATION REVIEW HEARING.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
IPretrial Incarceration Credit.   mld

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Brian K. Hazard in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin. 
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor), (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 946.49(1)(a) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor."   **This now makes this charge a misdemeanor.  mld

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court (via telephonics), defendant Brian K Hazard not in court, in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Due to the unavailability of the court, Plea and Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to branch 4 on 4-24-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Brian K Hazard in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant acknowledged receipt of discovery including an offer letter to resolve all (4) four cases.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-31-2014 at 1:30 pm.  

Statement made by Diane P., to request modification of the no contact order.  Court maintains the current no contact order.  mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew).   mld

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Brian K Hazard not in court, in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
   Court vacates bench warrant.  Defendant has a new case (2014CF669), scheduled for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-3-2014 at 1:30 pm.   Motion of the State to modify bail is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court increased bail to $2,500.00 with gps supervision on cases 2013CF44211, 2013CF5610 and 2014CF155.  Court maintains the cash bail on 2014CF669 with the addition of gps supervision.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 3-3-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Monies to be held for recompense, per the Court.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 FILE NOT IN COURT.  Defendant NOT in Court.
Court is in receipt of a Justice Point violation for a positive drug test.  The Court was advised from Justice Point, at 11:50 am, that the defendant was present and tested positive today's date for Oxycodone.  Clerk advised Joycelyn Sanders from Justice Point, (via telephone), that the defendant should appear before branch 4, this afternoon at 1:30 pm.  Case called on the record at 2:43 pm.  Defendant was not present.  For the reasons as stated on the record, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue. Court ordered cash bond forfeited.  Court vacates the Plea and Sentencing Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 2-19-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 FILE NOT IN COURT.
 Attorney Enku Edgar Lin appeared for defendant on cases (2013CF5610 and 2014CF155).  Court heard and granted the Motion of Attorney Mark Tishberg to Withdraw as Defense Counsel on case 2013CF4411.  Attorney Enku Edgar Lin, will now be defense counsel of record on all three cases for defendant.  Attorney Tischberg will turn over all available discovery on case 2013CF4411 to Attorney Lin at the Public Defender's Office on 1-22-2014.  

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery.  

Statement made by Diane P., to request modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification to the no contact order.  

Court ordered case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 2-19-2014 at 1:30 pm.    mld
